body: Born of two very different worlds, half-elves rarely have easy childhoods. Torn as half-elves are between disparate peoples, the presence of their families helps ensure they do not grow up totally alone, though orphaned half-elves have to create families of their own.
name: Half-Elf

sections.body:
Half-Elf Homeland
d%Result
01—25Raised in an Elven Homeland: Roll on the Elf Homeland table.
26—75Raised in a Human Homeland: Roll on the Human Homeland table.
76—95Forest: You gain access to the Log Roller regional trait.
96—100Unusual Homeland: Roll on the Unusual Homeland table.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Background Generator/Step 1-Homeland/Family/and Childhood/Half-Elf/Half-Elf Homeland
sections.name: Half-Elf Homeland

sections.body:
Half-Elf Parents
d%Result
01—20Both of your parents are alive.
21—55Only your father is alive.
56—90Only your mother is alive.
91—100Both of your parents are dead. You gain access to the Orphaned social trait.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Background Generator/Step 1-Homeland/Family/and Childhood/Half-Elf/Half-Elf Parents
sections.name: Half-Elf Parents

sections.body:
Half-Elf Siblings
d%Result
01—201d2 half-siblings (either elf or human, your choice). With two or more siblings, you gain access to the Kin Guardian combat trait.
21—30One half-elf sibling. You gain access to the Kin Bond magic trait.
31—100No siblings.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Character Background/Background Generator/Step 1-Homeland/Family/and Childhood/Half-Elf/Half-Elf Siblings
sections.name: Half-Elf Siblings
